page.title: 09ARUNDALE SCHOOL, PULBOROUGH.
page.content: Preparatory day school in Lower Street built in 1811 as an inn, became a school in 1953 for girls & boys. Extra rooms & a tennis court were added. 146 pupils in 9 classes. School begins at 9.15 with assembly. 8 lessons a day,35 minutes each, include English, gym, maths,French,history,geography,science art & music. Sports played are hockey, netball,rounders,football,tennis.Piano elocution,flute,clarinet,guitar & judo are taught also. Gold stars & house points are awarded for effort. The uniform is green, white and grey. Most pupils arise at 7.00am. & travel from local villages. Most come from professional families & go on to public schools.
